SCORE: 7/10 - GOOD
Roundabout is a silly game featuring pulse-pounding driving action, backed up with an enthralling plot that incorporates some of the most compelling acting I've ever witnessed. Indeed, the sheer theatrical talent on display makes Roundabout Oscar-caliber stuff! Unfortunately, it seems obvious that the leaderboards have been hacked by cheaters.

author: {'steamid': '76561198040278708', 'num_games_owned': 487, 'num_reviews': 58, 'playtime_forever': 193, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 193, 'last_played': 1690059891}
review:
Georgio and Beth for life.

This is such a fun little game. If you enjoy cheesy cutscenes with deliberately bad acting, a game that does their best to be as bonkers as possible, and a ridiculous story, this is the game for you. The mechanics of the game are simple; you're a limousine driver that spins around. No seriously, you spin around 360 degrees constantly. You need to maneuver your way through a ton of short (3-8 minutes long) story-based missions, while running over passengers, traffic cones and avoiding cars. It can be frustrating at times, but after a while you can get really into it.

I strongly recommend playing with a controller. During my first playthrough several years ago (probably 2015?), I stopped after 2 hours, and I think I would've played the last hour of the story if I had a controller because it was so much easier to navigate through everything. The cutscenes is what makes this game so enjoyable. The acting is bad, and it's supposed to be. The costumes are cheap, because they're supposed to be. Georgio doesn't talk, because she's Georgio and she shouldn't talk. The entire game gives off a sleazy '70s vibe and it feels very natural and humorous. 

The story is pretty insane as well. I don't wanna go into it, because I don't want to spoil it for y'all, but there are some twists and turns (ha!) and some pretty weird sh-t happening. And that's what makes this game great!

And let's not forget about the customizability. You have hats, different colors and different horns for your limousine. On top of that, you have several different upgrades for your limousine that you're able to switch freely. Wanna slow down time to squeeze through a tight gap more accurately? Go for it. Wanna double-jump? Be my guest. Rotate (ha) freely between spinning clockwise and counter-clockwise? Why not! And there's plenty of customizability and upgrades to unlock post-story as well. I finished the story-mode and I've only finished the game 26% - there's still a ton to discover, and plenty of challenges to try out if I feel daring enough.

An absolutely excellent game that is truly underrated.
9.5/10 (would've received 10 if I had better temper)

author: {'steamid': '76561198028382102', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 94, 'playtime_forever': 2487, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 132, 'last_played': 1677417042}
review:
Found out about this game after Game Grumps played it on YT. What a gem of a game I've never seen this pop up when browsing through steam over the years (Came out in 2014!?). It's fun, has a lot of heart put into it and there's a lot of little extras with the Deluxe Edition (Random videos of gameplay or the actors doing fun things).

Gameplay wise it's kind of puzzle-esque because you're always spinning in a limo you need to think about how to fit through places. 

There are some issues/annoyances with this game though. Personally at first I powered through most of the game but the more I progressed the more I found myself running out of patience with the game.
- You do die quite easily and that's mainly because you can get stuck between obstacles and basically chain hits until your vehicle explodes (A little funny at times with the noises). 
- When you respawn some locations are prone to adding a hit to your vehicle right off the bat. - The hit detection with sloped terrain causing you to take hits which can absolutely ruin a run you're doing (eg. You can get onto carousel tops but the shape of them can cause to you get hit...).
- Some times the respawn points are super far (Even though you're closer to one - These aren't always the wrench locations) so this leads to more backtracking than you need.
- There is an "item finder" which may be considered a spoiler but it seems to not work properly. It also gives off "false positives" which pings in areas just once and you cannot replicate it again so you're left wondering if there truly is an item nearby which completely makes you lose faith in using it at all...

author: {'steamid': '76561198078403549', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 581, 'playtime_forever': 175, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 175, 'last_played': 1673543591}

author: {'steamid': '76561198067279402', 'num_games_owned': 43, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 347, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 180, 'last_played': 1705281527}
review:
Inesperado, divertido e estupidamente barato.

Eu ganhei esse jogo de presente e eu fui proibida de pesquisar sobre (inclusive na Steam) pra ter a experiência de jogar às cegas. A gameplay é caótica, mas pra quem, como eu, cresceu jogando Crazy Taxi, o jeito maluco que funciona Roundabout dá pra se acostumar e é bem divertida.

E, por incrível que pareça, os controles são bem fáceis, é só você ter que aprender a lidar com uma limousine em constante rotação e saber bem o que é esquerda e direita/horário e anti-horário (que não é o meu caso). 

Gostei muito das cutscenes e a "história" do jogo. Foi feito pra se parecer como um filme B dos anos 70 e a produção acertou em cheio, tanto no humor, quanto na caracterização e roteiro.

Pela entrega geral, eu achei 5 reais MUITO barato.

E sim, eu fiquei cantando mentalmente Roundabout do Yes.

author: {'steamid': '76561198093913293', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 203, 'playtime_forever': 98, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 75, 'last_played': 1681498226}
review:
Surprisingly charming game, full of quirk and challenge.
Not without its flaws though.

Pros:
- Fun theme of 70s art and quality, in many aspects.
- Decent open world map, with lots of variety and collectibles.
- Unique gameplay design that can be challenging to learn, let alone master, but can feel very rewarding when you beat the challenges.
- Plenty of customization, from horns, paints, hats, and powers.
- Fun story of awkward cutscenes and acting, that while doesn't always hit, is a respectable attempt at FMV silliness.

Cons:
- VERY awkward feeling controls at times. Many times, you will find yourself in a situation where it's too late to fix your mistake, and will suffer multiple hits straight to death in seconds.
- Poorly designed respawns. In open world, you often respawn far away from where you died. In missions, you often respawn very close to where you died, instead of at checkpoints. This should be the opposite.
- Pricing of things, from customization to property, is very uneven. Some things are more expensive than others to unlock, and it's unclear why sometimes.
- No idea why the Passengers only have a black background for their windows. Maybe it's to add to the intentionally cheap look, but it just hurts the scene. It should be greenscreened, like what our driver has. Maybe it was gonna, but something happened with the reflections or something.

author: {'steamid': '76561197971838196', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 356, 'playtime_forever': 189, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 189, 'last_played': 1648907541}
review:
Spielwertung: 10/10
Spielzeit: 3 Stunden (Gesamt)
Spieldurchgänge: 1 (Ende, nur Story, 36%)

Ich weiß nicht, was es mit diesen Spielen auf sich hat, die echte Schauspieler für ihre Zwischenszenen nutzen, aber trotz des trashigen Settings will man wie bei einer Sitcom immer weiterschauen.

Roundabout hat zurecht so hohe Wertungen. Eine riesige Limousine, die sich nur drehend bewegt? Kleine Hindernisse wie "Menschen" einfach ummäht, aber bei Größeren wie Häusern oder Bäumen Schaden nimmt und explodiert? WTF! Es ist einfach nur super-lustig. Ich bin in den 3 Stunden sicher hunderte Male "gestorben" und musste jedes Mal dabei lachen, das Spiel ist so gaga, dass man gar nicht auf Leveldesign oder Schwierigkeitsgrad sauer sein kann.

Interessiert hat mich dabei nur die "Story", die eigentlich gar nicht existiert, einfach wegen den Schauspielern. Deswegen auch "nur" 3 Stunden, bis es leider wieder vorbei war. Wer Lust auf das Gamedesign hat, kann sicher noch viel länger die Welt erkunden und versuchen alles dort zu finden.

Fazit: Roundabout ist Trash, aber die Sorte von Trash, die wir zurecht als Kunst bezeichnen. Klare Empfehlung!

author: {'steamid': '76561198026262213', 'num_games_owned': 341, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 343, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 343, 'last_played': 1646453423}
review:
For each of these reviews I’ll be grading the game on a scale to 100.  Some parts are worth more points than others, that is just personal preference to me as it’s just what I prioritize more when it comes to games.  I’m definitely a “Gameplay > Graphics” guy, so that’ll show in these articles.  Let’s hop in.

Spoiler-Free Synopsis: In the game Roundabout, you play as Georgio Manos, a truly silent protagonist who communicates purely through facial expression.  She also runs the world’s first rotating limousine service.  You spend the game driving customers around town which includes, game proclaimed, “‘70s B-Movie Full Motion Video” cutscenes.  Work your way through three different areas of the city of Roundabout and establish yourself as the best rotating limousine service in the world!

Graphics: 9/10.  The graphics look great.  The world is very colorful, the cutscenes (as mentioned earlier) as FMV cutscenes that take place entirely in your limousine, with the rare cutscene that involves B-movie flair of “person talks in front of green screen”.   

Controls: 9/10.  The controls are actually very fair.  The car drives very smoothly, the power ups that you unlock as you play all activate as they should, the ability to change direction is smooth.  Anytime that I failed something, I never felt cheated by the game, it just felt that I made a mistake myself.  There’s really only one thing I didn’t like and it came in one of the final missions of the game so I will keep it off here for the sake of spoiler.

Gameplay: 25/30.  Gameplay is streamlined, but that’s ok in this case.  You drive to a mission point, pick up someone, drive them somewhere, maybe do a side task or two, and then drop them off.  Your next mission is then usually right next to you after that.  There are lots of things that block your path, whether it be cars backing up and going forward in the middle of the street, cars going around in… roundabouts… and even rock sculptures that CONVENIENTLY are just close enough to each other that you just barely can’t fit between them at every angle and you have to slide through while spinning.  You will eventually unlock the ability to jump, which opens up a lot of potential shortcuts or secrets that you can collect, but then you also realize that this sculpture you’re trying to get past is just low enough that if you’re jumping, you’ll hit it.  Your car blows up after it hits a few things and you’ll get sent back to either the last checkpoint if you’re on a mission (which are pretty generous) or the closest repair shop if you’re not on a mission.  

Story/Characters: 30/30.  I LOVE the story of Roundabout, and not because it’s a story worthy of an Oscar or some sort of award, but because it doesn’t take itself seriously at all.  Some characters are just common stereotypes like Disco Sylvain, or a Canadian Tourist who you know he’s Canadian because he’s waving a miniature flag of Canada all the time and says “Eh?” a lot.  But it’s not a form of offensive stereotyping, it’s just poking fun.  Georgio herself is one of my favorite parts of the game.  As I said earlier, she is a true silent protagonist, she never says a single word throughout the game.  Most of her “dialogue” is her just turning her head to the person who just got in her car, or pointing at something, or facial expressions.  Story is very easy to follow, but you still get invested in making this limo company the best.  I want to go more into characters, but it’s just something that’s better experienced in the game itself.

Replayability: 17/20.  I’m gonna be honest with you, despite this review series being about games I’ve never played before, I have played Roundabout before back at the end of 2020.  Coming back to it a little over a year later, I love it just as much as I did then.  It’s a story that I can watch again and again and still get a kick out of everything involved.  There’s also a variety of minigames you can play, or if you really want to test your skills, you can play the “Esports Speedrunning Challenge”, which skips all the cutscenes and you just go from checkpoint to checkpoint completing the entire game in one go.  My personal best is 31 minutes, 5 seconds.

Total Score: 90/100.  Roundabout is one of my favorite games I’ve played recently.  I know I spent a lot of time gushing about the characters, but the characters are what make this game what it is, in my opinion.  It’s incredibly charming, and a single playthrough only takes about 3-4 hours.  It’s a great way to spend a few hours that you don’t know what to do with for a reasonable price point of $10.

author: {'steamid': '76561198004177245', 'num_games_owned': 403, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 330, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 280, 'last_played': 1702425248}
review: This game is amazing. A really simple concept (car go round) executed well, on maps that work well with it. The actual reason to buy it is for the cutscenes, every single one of which features the best video game acting I've ever seen.

author: {'steamid': '76561198071206305', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 123, 'playtime_forever': 235, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 235, 'last_played': 1633128526}
review:
I'm recommending this game for one reason: It's the closest I can get to playing Kurukuru Kururin on PC. Kurukuru Kururin is a series of 3 GameBoy Advance/GameCube games (none of which were released in North America and 2 of which were Japan-only) where you control a constantly-rotating bar and need to avoid making contact with walls and obstacles. They are colorful and charming games that are a lot of fun to play while also being quite challenging. While the presentation of Roundabout and Kururu Kururin could not be more different, the fundamental mechanic is the same and, because of that, I had fun with Roundabout. It's satisfying to deftly weave your way around around obstacles and barely squeeze through tight spaces.

Instead of offering a series of discrete stage like Kurukuru Kururin, Roundabout has elected to take place in an open-world environment. Playing as Giorgio Manos, chauffeur of a rotating limo service, it is your job to pick up a variety of passengers and bring them to their destinations. These missions are delivered via FMV sequences that are intentionally very cheesy, so depending on your tolerance for bad acting and cheap effects, you might find them charming or insufferable. For whatever reason Giorgio is a silent protagonist who never speaks and communicates through facial expressions, which would be fine except that none of her expressions seem to match the scenario she's responding to. I actually found it kind of off-putting after a while. The plot is incredibly silly and definitely not intended to be taken seriously, but at the same time I couldn't help but feel the writing didn't need to be this lazy. Beth (one of your first passengers) falls in love with you immediately for no real reason, and it's implied that Girgio reciprocates her feelings even though this is never really communicated. Several of the characters are simply stereotypes that are completely uninteresting. Luckily, you can skip the video sequences and just stick to the game proper if you prefer.

Most of the missions are simply to go from point A to point B. You are also given optional tasks that are assigned for every mission (collect all stars, reach the goal within X time, reach the goal without colliding with anything, etc). While you can maneuver with the analog stick alone, you can also hold the R trigger to move your car faster or the L trigger (I think) to slow down time. The speed boost is necessary for the most challenging time limits, but I decided early on it wasn't worth the effort to re-play missions several times in order to accomplish all the tasks. Oh, and you also eventually gain the ability to jump, an interesting mechanic that changes how you approach maneuvering. There are also a series of challenge stages that don't revolve around reaching a destination but are timed score challenges that involve doing things like running over as many people as possible or bouncing a soccer ball off the hood of your car. These are designed to be competitive (you are shown the leaderboards and compared to people on your friends' list) but I didn't feel compelled to play any of them more than a couple of times. There are also plenty of collectibles scattered about, giving you some reason to explore. You can find cash stashes and use your money to buy properties that you can periodically return to to collect income from. This money can then be used to buy cosmetics for your car like paint jobs or objects on the roof.

Unfortunately, the camera angle and iffy hit detection make it a bit difficult to tell when you're going to hit something. Worse, it's sometimes easy to get stun-locked and explode before you even have a chance to react. There's no real penalty for dying, though, so you're free to try as many times as you need to get past tricky areas. There is an odd bug I encountered where re-spawing on top of buildings sometimes causes you to explode instantly, contributing to the impression that this game could have used a little more polish. It's not as clean and precise as Kurukuru Kururin, but I do appreciate the unique take on the "rotating bar" genre even if the presentation left a little to be desired.

So if you've ever enjoyed Kurukuru Kururin or if the idea of manipulating a rotating limousine through obstacle courses sounds appealing to you, you might enjoy Roundabout.

author: {'steamid': '76561197975593715', 'num_games_owned': 2290, 'num_reviews': 216, 'playtime_forever': 101, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 101, 'last_played': 1630597568}
review:
https://youtu.be/glveJEYQO9M?t=504

Roundabout reminds me a lot of what happened when Quentin Tarantino and Robert Rodriguez released Grindhouse in 2007. It renewed interest in old school exploitation films and for a brief moment there, a lot of movies were greenlit that followed the same style and tone.

A few years ago, full motion video or FMV games also celebrated a resurgence, after mostly being considered dead for over a decade. I don’t know how many people are familiar with early examples of games that used live-action bits in lieu of pre-rendered or in-game cutscenes, but there used to be a time in the 90’s when a lot of games were billed more as interactive movies. Stuff like Wing Commander, Phantasmagoria, Night Trap, Ripper and the Tex Murphy games spring to mind.

Roundabout is one of those games that came out during this initial FMV resurgence. And I feel that it falls in exactly the same trap as many FMV games from the 90s did: The live-action movie segments are entirely separate from the gameplay that happens in-between and only treated as exposition.

During gameplay, you’re in control of a limousine and your job is to pick up passengers and deliver them to their intended destination. So far so Crazy Taxi. The only difference is that your Limousine constantly spins in a circle, so it’s less of a driving game and more about finding ways to steer your constantly rotating vehicle without bumping into anything else on the way. 

I have to say I’m not the biggest fan of the gameplay. Not because it’s bad, but because it’s so basic. There are a few upgrades you can install that change up the formula a bit, but by and large the challenge remains with avoiding obstacles. But even if you do collide with objects, it’s hardly that much of a setback, so you can basically brute force your way through anything the game can throw at you. Sure, if you’re intent on achieving 100% completion, you’ll probably end up replaying most of the missions and are basically required to beat every mission without failing, but these days, I’m really not inclined to force myself to achieve a perfect score and would rather want a game to be designed in such a way that inherently requires a certain amount of skill to beat.

Then again, most people aren’t here for the gameplay, they’re here for the hilarious FMV sequences. Can you tell that I’m being sarcastic? Now I absolutely love cheesy B-movies. But one thing that’s really important to me when I watch schlock is that it has to be something that wasn’t purposely made to be schlock. There are very few exceptions to this rule like Black Dynamite, which is less of a “me too” attempt at making schlock and more of a love letter to blaxploitation cinema. But by and large I can’t stand modern stuff that wants to imitate legitimately bad movies from the 70s and 80s. 

And this is something that many are probably going to disagree with me over. Remember Kung Fury from a few years ago? Yeah, I absolutely can’t stand that movie. And the reason is that the filmmakers are in on the joke. They saw all those terrible movies from the 80s that mashed genres together, had ridiculous characters and nonsensical plots and thought to themselves “I’m going to do exactly the same thing, only I’m being ironic and over the top about it”. And that’s simply not how camp works. You can’t force campiness, especially not if you’re doing it to be ironic. It has to come from a sincere attempt at creating something artistic and failing somewhere. Miami Connection isn’t a great example of schlock because it’s full of terrible dialogue, wooden acting and gloriously cheesy music. It’s great because all of that was intended to make a good film. Kung Fury wasn’t meant to be a good film. It was meant to be a pastiche. It was intended to make its audience point at it and say “look at how ridiculous this is”, hoping that the audience doesn’t notice that it was purposely made to evoke this kind of reaction.

Now the reason I bring this up is because the FMV sequences in Roundabout fall in exactly the same territory as Kung Fury. Sure, all the acting is terrible, all the characters are quirky one-note jokes but that’s the point. The schlock-value isn’t something that happened by accident, it was a deliberate attempt at aping bad 70s cinema and it just falls flat from beginning to end. Remember, intentionally bad is still bad, only without the guilty pleasure to act as a saving grace. There’s a very fine line to walk here and if you don’t manage to pull it off all the way through, it just comes off as being insincere. Death Proof was a film that tried to ape bad 80’s serial killer movies that padded out their runtime with terrible dialogue. But Death Proof’s padded dialogue was written by Quentin Tarantino, so even the quote unquote boring dialogue is engaging to watch and that’s why it works, that’s why Death Proof is still a great movie. Roundabout by contrast has non sequitur after non sequitur delivered by quirky character after quirky character and it just doesn’t want to create a holistic picture or be taken seriously on any level.

And like I said, the narrative and gameplay simply don’t integrate with each other. You could strip out all the cutscenes and the gameplay would still work just as well on its own. Conversely, you could’ve made this into a 70 minute movie and the FMV portion wouldn’t lose anything either. So unfortunately, I really can’t recommend Roundabout.

author: {'steamid': '76561198061737345', 'num_games_owned': 788, 'num_reviews': 160, 'playtime_forever': 549, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 549, 'last_played': 1629168292}
review:
[h1]So quirky I don't even think the word does it justice[/h1]

There are so many damn things I like about this game. It's quirky, has great characters, a unique concept, and hundreds of collectables. Surely, a game after my heart.

You play as Georgio, the world's first revolving limousine driver, a concept as impractical as it sounds. Surprisingly, the set-up is quite easy to adapt to, and you'll soon find yourself cruising down the street, dodging an onslaught of obstacles and mowing down hordes of pedestrians.

In places, it falls a bit short. There's no real challenge in the game. Sure, you have the [i]option[/i] to get 100% on every mission, but I found that even a really shoddy run where I exploded my limousine several times was enough to earn me a rating of around 65%, seeing as the mere completion of a level accounts for most of your score. There are irritating glitches, such as a persistent respawn glitch that causes your limousine to take damage upon spawning. This wouldn't be a problem if it weren't for the fact that most levels have a "don't take any damage" bonus, which can often be immediately negated upon restarting a mission.

Gripes aside, this is a really well put together title with a lot of personality to it. It doesn't overstay its welcome, leaving you feeling like you've just had enough by the time that the credits roll. [spoiler]By the way, if you drive as the ending credits "desert bus" for 8 hours, you'll earn an achievement, which is perhaps one of the dumbest achievements I've seen yet on Steam, and I hate myself even more for wanting to go for it someday.[/spoiler]

7/10

review:
This game is the perfect example of how to make a simple concept into a great game. 

The constantly spinning limo is already cool looking and well executed - however the setting story and level of comedy makes it amazing.

There is a large enough amount of collectibles that I feel satisfied at 40-50% but don't feel compelled to get 100%

author: {'steamid': '76561199067202097', 'num_games_owned': 239, 'num_reviews': 159, 'playtime_forever': 3741, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3741, 'last_played': 1621225012}
review:
Если бы единственным критерием качества игры была бы оригинальность идеи, Roundabout вошёл бы в число рекордсменов всех времён по положительным отзывам. Казалось бы, что ещё можно выжать из такой идеи, как развоз людей на такси? А как вам такое: транспортом у нас является длинный лимузин, который... непрерывно вращается вокруг своей оси! И при неаккуратном вождении сбивает ящики, заборы, людей, а потом и сам взрывается, получив достаточно повреждений. "Что это за трэш?" - спросите вы. Но это не трэш, это комедия! Второсортная комедия в стиле семидесятых годов с живыми(!) актёрами.
Привыкнув к необычному геймплею и необычной же стилистике, мы попадаем в открытый мир, состоящий из трёх городов, где на вращающейся технике обслуживаем разнообразных пассажиров. Дети не успевают в школу, тренер бейсбольной команды - на площадку, священник - на службу, а шведский турист в качестве пункта назначения называет "sockergris". Понять, что он имеет ввиду, у сидящей за рулём Джорджио Манос получается не с первого раза. "Sockergris? Saw cow gris?" "Отвези его уж куда нибудь" - гласит в конце концов панель текущего задания. И таких ситуаций немало, канадские разработчики не постеснялись обстебать даже самих себя - канадцев.
Извозом дело не ограничивается. Правда, другие задания нам попадаются нечасто, но зато в этот момент фантазия у разработчиков не ограничивается ничем. И в футбол играем, и гробы в могилы скидываем, и урожай на ферме собираем, и даже от падающих с неба машин спасаемся. А под воздействием кое-каких конфеток Джорджио встречается с живым скелетом и отправляется кататься по морскому дну, а потом ещё и охоту за отдыхающими на пляже устраивает.

В общем, веселья полные штаны. Первый час. Но вскоре эффект оригинальности сходит на нет, и взору открываются минусы, убивающие весь фан. Первое, с чем сталкиваешься - с однообразием. Все эти фермы и футболы встречаются редко, в основном же задания - обычное "езжай туда, потом туда, и наконец туда, и по пути преодолей одни и те же препятствия из мешающих автомобилей или бетонных ограничителей". Редко когда приходится прыгать по крышам (да-да, мы и такому научимся) или уворачиваться от погрузочной техники в порту, в основном - всё одно и то же.
Второе, что раздражает чем дальше, тем сильнее - перемещение по городу. Проклятый лимузин даже в этом режиме не перестаёт вращаться, так что поездка до очередного задания сама по себе становится заданием. С той разницей, что в свободном режиме после очередного взрыва мы восстанавливаемся не на последней контрольной точке, а не пойми где. В итоге, некоторые задания не просто выполнить, а ПОЛУЧИТЬ выходит только с десятых попыток. Это расстраивает.
Третий минус - продолжительность компании. Если уж вы решили проследить за глуповатой, но более-менее забавной истории Джорджио, то будьте готовы узнать о развязке через несколько часов. Иным высокоскилловым игрокам и часа(!) хватит.
Зато после прохождения у нас останется возможность покататься по здешнему миру и повыполнять задания, поискать спрятанные в кустах деньги, пособирать интересные звуки гудка, банально подавить педестриан... Но тут, как контрольный выстрел, нас ожидает очередной минус. Всего. Этого. В. Игре. ОЧЕНЬ. Много! На карте показывается только доступная для покупки недвижимость (за сдачи её в аренду можно заработать денег), а деньги, гудки и просто синие отметки, нужные лишь для соответствующей ачивки, ищите сами где хотите. Поскольку даже простое перемещение по городу - уже сложность, энтузиазм от поиска спрятанных предметов быстро улетучивается. Не легче дело обстоит и с выполнением заданий: чтобы исполнить его на сто процентов, нам нужно соблюсти кучу условий. "Пройди за такое-то время, пройди, не взорвавшись, пройдя и собери все монетки, что встретятся по пути, пройди, не пользуясь бустером, пройди ничего не задев, пройди без прыжков..." Не за раз, конечно, нужно всё это делать, но в итоге выходит, что одно и то же задание для стопроцентного результата следует пройти с десяток раз. А потом все остальные так же. Надо ли говорить, что это не очень интересно?
Про ачивки тоже скажу. Среди них встречаются такие неадекватные, что словами не описать. Жёсткие требования выполнения тех или иных челленджей - это ещё можно стерпеть, но, скажем, "посигналь 1000 раз" в игре, где сигналка вообще не используется - это зачем? А "сделай 53596 оборотов лимузина"? В спокойном состоянии на один оборот требуется около 4 секунд. Простые арифметические вычисления дают в итоге около ШЕСТИДЕСЯТИ ЧАСОВ для получения достижения. Зачем это??? Но всех переплюнула ачивка "Smoke & Mirrors". Даже писать о ей не буду, вы мне не поверите, что такое могло прийти в голову адекватным людям. Почитайте в руководстве сами.

Что же в итоге? Очень печальный вывод: у игры есть демо-версия, и лучше бы вам поиграть в неё. Пойдите несколько заданий, проникнитесь весёлой атмосферой, познакомьтесь с оригинальной игровой механикой. А полную версию лучше не берите. Разочарований будет больше, чем положительных эмоций.

author: {'steamid': '76561197996719747', 'num_games_owned': 475, 'num_reviews': 75, 'playtime_forever': 224, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 146, 'last_played': 1621729597}
review:
Actually a good video game and worth playing. 
It's like an open world Kururin game, which means that the "maze" level designs aren't as refined down to the detail since you can often take multiple routes or re-use part of the world in multiple challenges, but it also means that it feels fresh and has more exploring and collecting to do.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970952979', 'num_games_owned': 2552, 'num_reviews': 144, 'playtime_forever': 176, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 176, 'last_played': 1617573037}
review:
This game is absolute chaos and it is wonderful

You play Georgio Manos, a silent yet skilled Limo driver with a single creed:  REVOLVE FOREVER!   Genuinely a highlight is seeing what wacky character will show up next, and Gorgio's expression alone telling a full story of her opinions of what's in her passenger seats.

The gameplay is insane and the gimmick makes it near impossible to do anything properly, but the game surprisingly lenient so if you just want to muddle through and get all of the glorious cheesy cutscenes and story then you can without needing to grind or practice!

Took me 3 hours to complete the story and laughed at every turn of it

author: {'steamid': '76561198044916562', 'num_games_owned': 839, 'num_reviews': 32, 'playtime_forever': 472, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 472, 'last_played': 1615326149}
review:

- tons of collectibles and bonus content, none of which is required

- barely any loading times

Cons:

- some times broken respawn

- can't change keybindings
- limited control over vehicle

author: {'steamid': '76561198118213076', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 80, 'playtime_forever': 1453, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1453, 'last_played': 1614015982}
review:
Les soy sincero, este es un juego bastante extraño pero divertido y retador. La mecánica principal me recordó mucho a Kuru Kuru Kururin (un juego de Game Boy Advance que jugué ya hace años) pero llevado a otro nivel, desarrollado en un mundo abierto con objetivos secundarios, mini juegos y una historia que se va contando entre misiones con escenas parecidas a las películas de Clase B de los años 70s.
Georgia Manos es el personaje principal y tiene un problema o habilidad como lo quieras ver y es que solo puede manejar girando en círculos con la limusina, así que básicamente deberemos  transportar a nuestros pasajeros esquivando obstáculos y evitando explotar para llegar a nuestro destino. La historia en sí es graciosa y algo confusa pero tiene de todo un poco, romance, drogas, persecuciones policiales y un esqueleto parlante. 
La música del juego es agradable pero al no tener variedad a la larga llega a cansar y el otro punto negativo es que si realmente quieres completar el juego al 100% te encontraras con unos cuantos achievements que a mi parecer son bastante ridículos.
Lo recomiendo mucho, es un juego entretenido.

I   r e g r e t   n o t h i n g

author: {'steamid': '76561199124823651', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 268, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 147, 'last_played': 1656425334}
review: İndirim kuponuyla aldığım ve bayıldığım müthiş bir oyun. Karakterimiz Georgio Manos; kendisi nedeni bilinmez ama konuşmuyor fakat konuşmamasına rağmen karşıdaki kişiye mimikleriyle istediğini anlatabiliyor. Ara sahnelerinde oyun içi yerine gerçek görüntüler kullanılmış. Oyun, dönen bir aracı kontrol etmekten ibaret ve arada eğlenceli mini-game'ler var. Müşteriler var ve onları alıyorsunuz. Onları gitmek istedikleri yerlere götürüyorsunuz fakat tabikide karşınıza engeller çıkıyor. Bunları geçe geçe hikayeye devam ediyorsunuz. İlk başlarda alışması zor olabilir, size rage attırabilir (ki ben oyunun ortalarında bile attım bikaç kez :D) ama sırf hikayesi ve mizahı için bile oynanabilecek bir türden.

author: {'steamid': '76561197999045600', 'num_games_owned': 695, 'num_reviews': 226, 'playtime_forever': 146, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 146, 'last_played': 1610334528}
review:
I didn't think I would like this game, and when I first started playing I was a bit baffled by the gameplay but once I got used to it I was hooked.  

I love how this game uses live actors to tell the story because it reminds me of all of those cheesy FMV games from the 1990s.  The story is absolutely ridiculous and excellent, which is why went I through the entire thing during my first playthrough.  I still have plenty of stuff to unlock, however, but the gameplay is addictive enough that achievement hunting doesn't feel like a boring grind.  

It's a great pick-up-and-play type of game and I highly recommend it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198024972303', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 249, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 249, 'last_played': 1609720332}
review:
When I watched a friend of mine play this game, it reminded me of the golden age of flash games when I was a kid. In other words, a game made on a ridiculous premise and exploring gameplay based around the concept. In the case of Roundabout, take a limo that can only do donuts and try to get from point A to point B as fast as possible without dying. 

Gameplay wise, I very much enjoy it. You can replay any mission an infinite amount of times with whatever abilities you unlock later in the game. Every mission has objectives that cannot realistically be done in one playthrough of the mission. Thankfully you can do a run through focused on completing only one task on the checklist. For example, collecting all of the collectible star coins in the mission. The game remembers which collectibles you had already collected through your sunsequent playthroughs so you can focus on only collecting the coins you have missing. The game has both friends list and global ranking systems with friends list being used for all activities and global only being used on challenges (which are repeatable with no real point other than to flex among your friends and the player base). 

There are however some issues with the game. If your limo dies and the previous checkpoint was on top of a building, you will die again as the limo gets respawned inside the building rather than on top. Further complicating things is that there is no way for players to know how much money they have while driving unless they drive over a purchasable property or collect a hidden money stash. The game also does not tell you how many star coins you have left to find when doing another runthrough of a mission only getting an update when you run over a new star coin. Another bug I found was that sometimes when you respawn your car starts off in a damaged state (you can take damage 4 times before dying on a fifth hit) which ruins any flawless or time trial attempts.

I give the game an 8/10. It is a corny gem that does a lot of things right for completionists, though some bugs and oversights do make 100% the game frustrating.

author: {'steamid': '76561198068122256', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 41, 'playtime_forever': 110, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 110, 'last_played': 1511652398}

review: I didn't know what I was getting into and it was quite fun and the live acting is hilariously aware of how bad it is but also perfect for the weird world its based in. Georgio as the silent protagonist and your lady Beth, who is always rooting for you. Love, explosions, drugs, and skeletons - this game has it all.

author: {'steamid': '76561198209168331', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 154, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 154, 'last_played': 1602012100}
review:
De principio y sin tapujos decir que este juego no va a ser del agrado de cualquiera. Yo mismo lo vi con escepticismo al comienzo, en especial por la jugabilidad de la limusina rotatoria. En un principio cuesta acostumbrarse a esta forma de conducir, pero luego se queda impregnado en la memoria. 

Lo que hace único a este juego es la forma en que narra la historia, es sumamente extraño, pero genial, divertido, ingenioso. Es un gusto adquirido. Pasarlo hasta el final prestando atención a la historia es algo que merece la pena. 

Personalmente no me ha apetecido terminarlo al 100%, pero hay mucho contenido y coleccionables. Es muy a la vieja escuela, en el sentido de ser un juego que te alienta a conseguir puntajes cada vez más altos. Recomendable, sí, pero jugarlo bajo la consigna de que es un juego para nada convencional.

author: {'steamid': '76561198035100973', 'num_games_owned': 395, 'num_reviews': 766, 'playtime_forever': 470, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 114, 'last_played': 1649164153}
review:
Disclaimer: My scores/reviews are almost always based on having bought the game at close to the "lowest historical price" on steam at time of purchase.

Quick score: 4/5

Notes: Great game, suprised this isn't much more popular on steam. The cutscenes/acting are extremely stupid but they made me laugh/smile almost every time. And the gameplay is extremely fun and smooth. Offers a ton of fairly difficult optional challenges and collectibles for you to go for once you have played through the story.


Couple noteworthy negatives 

#1 The jumping ability kind of breaks the challenge and fundamental flow of the game once you unlock it IMO. Once you unlock the jump ability it trivializes alot of the challenges and obstacles, not completely, but significantly. Would have preffered if it was implemented slightly differently, or that there were jump pads or something, rather than just a player input with no cooldown.

#2 IMO there shouldn't have been respawning enabled during missions. The missions are all incredibly short as is and the game could have used an overall difficulty boost, disabling respawning would have done this fine. (It also doesn't make much sense in terms of the story, having you and the passenger die and respawn like nothing happened lol)

author: {'steamid': '76561198401925621', 'num_games_owned': 1136, 'num_reviews': 110, 'playtime_forever': 192, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 192, 'last_played': 1585277701}
review:
This game is such a ball of cheese.  It so cheesy and it revels in its own cheesiness.  The story is unbelievably stupid. The acting is so bad that calling it terrible would be paying it a compliment. The gameplay is complete nonsense.  So why the thumbs up?

This game was, surprisingly, a lot of fun.  The whole perpetually spinning car concept was awkward AF to start.  So much so that after wrestling with it for 10-15 minutes, I thought “F@ck this stupid sh!t“ and was about to quit and uninstall the game.  I gave it another few minutes... and then the whole thing clicked.  Once I got the hang of how the controls worked, I played through the whole game in one sitting, which is incredibly rare for me.

I did think the game ended rather abruptly; it all was over in about 3 hours.  Plus the story really goes nowhere.  But I’ll be damned if this game wasn’t a memorable one - I’ll definitely remember this game for years to come.  It really is a unique experience and the gameplay is more polished than it appears.

If you’re a gamer looking for something different., pick this one up during the next Steam sale.

author: {'steamid': '76561198057364631', 'num_games_owned': 492, 'num_reviews': 124, 'playtime_forever': 122, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 122, 'last_played': 1584766057}
review:
I think the trailer shows off how funny this game is, which is probably its biggest selling point, and I can confirm this is consistent throughout.
On top of this, driving a spinning limousine doesn't get boring before the game is over. There is enough complexity added over time to keep it interesting. I also like how this game handles difficulty, because getting around without hitting stuff is pretty difficult, but it has frequent checkpoints, so it never gets frustrating. The downside to this is that it doesn't usually feel like I'm achieving much. However, there are challenges around, which allow you to set your own goals, making it pretty compelling.

There is only one problem, and that is that the game is quite short. There is lots of side content, but I finished the main story in about 2 hours. This might be too little content for $12, but I think its fun enough while its happening to be worth it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198358411456', 'num_games_owned': 414, 'num_reviews': 330, 'playtime_forever': 338, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 338, 'last_played': 1580657380}
review:
[h1]有玩過會飛又會跳又會轉的加長型禮車嗎？一起進入原地打轉的瘋狂世界吧！[/h1]
這是一款[strike]百合味十足[/strike]的70年代喜劇電影風格遊戲。玩家扮演無聲主角Georgio Manos，駕駛加長型禮車，一邊旋轉一邊靈巧的閃過沿途障礙物，體驗一場瘋狂的旅程和充滿歡笑的過程。
https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1986460499
[list]
    [*]縱橫三張地圖搭配禮車各種特殊能力隨你轉到爽！
    [*]不要問你會怕的Extra內個別設定…
    [*]幫加長型禮車車頂裝飾、車身造型貼、獨特喇叭聲！
    [*]驚喜連連的豪華版內容（遊玩初步開發原型、製作花絮影片、一分鐘舞動原聲帶）
    [*]好玩又有趣的挑戰模式（強烈推薦第一個與最後一個）
 [/list]https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1986762565
https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1986760024
那麼最後，請大家跟著我一起唱：
[h1]「You spin me right round, baby
Right round like a record, baby
Right round round round.」[/h1]

author: {'steamid': '76561197994242946', 'num_games_owned': 254, 'num_reviews': 143, 'playtime_forever': 128, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 128, 'last_played': 1504888217}
review: Roundabout, despite its breezy tone and graphics, is a complicated game. At one moment you may find yourself coolly in tune with the revolving mechanic and knocking past levels like it ain't no thing, but in the next, frustratingly smashing against the environment in an attempt to make a fractional amount of progress. However, the difficulty here may lie in the player's patience (or lack there of) and nothing tangibly related to the game. The bad FMV is, well, bad, but enjoyably so.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025087928', 'num_games_owned': 1005, 'num_reviews': 446, 'playtime_forever': 807, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 532, 'last_played': 1568201644}
review: It's just a whacky game that just all comes together in such an enjoyable package. The old school FMV and B-grade acting is perfect for the game and it's the right length that it won't take you too long to finish (if you just want to pass the missions and not try 100% everything), but as you progress and get additional skills it gives you reason to go back and explore everywhere. Pleasantly surprised with how much fun it turned out to be.

author: {'steamid': '76561198138854820', 'num_games_owned': 1501, 'num_reviews': 55, 'playtime_forever': 215, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 215, 'last_played': 1565146605}
review:
[h1]轉吧! 轉吧! 加長禮車，讓我開始變High吧! [/h1]


Roundabout講敘一名叫Georgio Manos的無口司機，憑藉著瘋狂的旋轉開車技術，所發生的故事，在路途上，Georgio會碰上許多古怪的乘客，還會遇到許多詼諧有趣的鬧事。 當初我是在商店頁面看到Roundabout的影片，當初看影片裡旋轉禮車就覺得很有趣，然後就買了，玩了後才知道這遊戲「不簡單」，所謂的「不簡單」就是遊戲裡障礙物很多，旋轉禮車一個不小心就會出車禍，出車禍就是喜劇片常出現的爆炸，而Roundabout是一款喜劇遊戲，當玩家被剛才的障礙物爆炸搞得很火大時，Roundabout就會推出許多搞笑內容來化解玩家的怒火，讓玩家心情再次變好，筆者在遊玩時，雖然常被遊戲裡賭爛的出生點和障礙物搞到心情不好，在總期望趕快過關來看接下來的驚喜，而驚喜呢，像是天降飛車、車踢足球等，多樣的內容讓人感到滿意，除此之外，遊戲裡充滿著過場動畫，以真人真景來拍攝，過場動畫充滿誇張形式來演出，不過有幾個角色的表演過於單調，讓人記不起來，但仍然不影響遊戲體驗。  遊戲車輛也有客製化和特異功能，你可以使用放慢動作，也可以使用潛水功能，也可讓車子跳起來，再加上車子的外觀改造，可以換噴漆外，最特殊的，是可以讓車子帶帽子，到帽子這方面讓人快笑死，這款遊戲是一款讓人滿意的小品遊戲，唯一的缺點是在任務時車子出生點容易卡點，導致車子爆炸，這點讓人感到不滿。其餘都沒有問題，是款可以輕鬆搞笑的小品遊戲。


[h1]推薦分數: 8/10[/h1]

[b]對於我們的評論有興趣嗎? 歡迎關注[/b] [url=https://store.steampowered.com/curator/33425668/]遊戲大雜燴鑑賞家[/url] [b]，給我們的評論一個喜歡和讚，您的支持就是我們的動力。[/b]

review: The game is simply you driving around trying not to explode in a revolving limo. If that doesn't compel you to play I don't know what will. There's a-lot of charm in the cut-scenes and music. To be honest I fell in love with it after about five minutes. This is definitely a very unique game. If you like a bit of a challenge this may be up your alley. Come for the spinning limo, stay for the snazzy, popping music, and a love story that puts Twilight to shame.

author: {'steamid': '76561198013723081', 'num_games_owned': 1047, 'num_reviews': 368, 'playtime_forever': 244, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 244, 'last_played': 1559357945}
review:
Hello friends. I just played this game. It has some interesting mechanics, as you drive, but not in the traditional way. Your a limo driver that does one thing..spin, spin, and spin...It is a very interesting play mechanic. It also features live scenes. Anyways, here is my Pro's and Con's:

PROS:

-A interesting mechanic in a driving game, revolving and spinning driving. This actually takes some puzzle elements into the game too so you can fit into certain spots in the game.

-Live Action scenes. There are live movies which are voiced and acted out. The acting in some scenes is very funny. I laughed at a couple of them. This game does not take itself serious either..so that adds to the humour.

-Replay to collect collectables around the map.

-Different modes of play (some open after beating game).


CONS:

- The spinning driving might be not everyone's favorite game . 

- The voice acting is well..not that great, but it does add to game to make it funny.

-Some of the achievements are extremely time sensitive..and seem very long to me. For example, there is one achievement where you need to play for 8 hours to get it? That is a long time to get a achievement...

For all it's sillyness, i want to recommend this game. I think this game is more like a 1970's B movie..at least it feels like that to me. Anyways, it is a silly game with funny live action scenes. The game itself is solid. The strange roatating mechanic is even interesting. For all this, i still find the game a bit silly.

author: {'steamid': '76561198273839604', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 1274, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1255, 'last_played': 1559171906}
review:
各ミッションで、細かくチェックポイントが設けられています。ですので、全ミッションをクリアするだけならば、そこまでは難しくないと思います。問題はミッションごとに設定されたチャレンジです。
・タイムアタック
・衝突なし
・ジャンプ未使用
・コイン全回収
・回転方向変更なし
などあり、簡単に達成できるものから、難しいものまで揃っています。すべてを達成しようとしたら、何回もプレイする必要がでてくるでしょう。また、札束やホーンなど収集要素もあり、ミッション外でのフリー走行でも楽しめるようになっています。リフティングなどのミニゲームもあります。そして、ある意味このゲームで一番の見どころである、ミッション中に挟まる謎実写。英語が苦手なせいで、すべて理解できないのが悔しい！

ちょっと残念なのが、プレイ前に操作方法の説明がなく、カスタマイズもできないこと。基本的な操作は直感的で、説明が無くてもすぐにわかります。しかし、右アナログスティックでカメラの寄りを変更できることをクリア後しばらくしてから気付きました。また、右トリガーの高速回転(そこからの大ジャンプ)も、中盤、2つ目のマップになって説明されます。それを知らず、1つ目のマップで取れない収集物を前に何回も大破爆散したのは私だけではないはず、、、

頻繁にセールも行われていますし、ちょっとした空き時間にプレイするゲームとしておすすめです。

author: {'steamid': '76561198045122397', 'num_games_owned': 657, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 443, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 388, 'last_played': 1708014329}

Anyway, this is probably one of the most arcade-y games I've played in years. It might not be for everyone, but I found it to be a fun and casual. The story is laughable, but that's the point.

author: {'steamid': '76561198109862147', 'num_games_owned': 1460, 'num_reviews': 47, 'playtime_forever': 541, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 541, 'last_played': 1546040488}
review: I really liked this by the end. I didn't expect it at first, but the strange FMV scenes turned into a surprising story. You can also unlock various powers, jump on buildings, buy different paint and decoration for your limo, etc.

author: {'steamid': '76561198017070181', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 72, 'playtime_forever': 273, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 273, 'last_played': 1544306611}
review: Short and sweet. The arcade gameplay sometimes got a little frustrating because I don't always have the patience to time things exactly right, but it was still worth it to watch all of the campy FMVs that clearly have a lot of heart, which is the highlight of this game's charm. I only wish there was more of it because honestly the main story is probably around an hour long at most (just took me longer because I suck lol). After the story's over, the only things left are collectibles and mini-challenges (which will be even more frustrating if the main game is hard for you), so unless that's your thing, I'd recommend waiting for a sale.

author: {'steamid': '76561198094362022', 'num_games_owned': 1514, 'num_reviews': 74, 'playtime_forever': 11, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 11, 'last_played': 1473509611}

author: {'steamid': '76561197969749884', 'num_games_owned': 2459, 'num_reviews': 1422, 'playtime_forever': 22812, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 22812, 'last_played': 1537252927}
review:
Roundabout, while looking like a marriage of Goat Simulator and Taxi Driver, is a very unique experience and an excellently absurd open world hilarity game.

The FMVs are just plain genius and even if the game wasn't as much fun as it actually is (which is a lot), those alone would make it worth to continue playing.

One of the most refreshing experiences I have played in a while and another testament that ingenuity hasn't died yet within the gaming industry. If I could give multiple thumbs up, I would.

author: {'steamid': '76561198045716689', 'num_games_owned': 1047, 'num_reviews': 144, 'playtime_forever': 385, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 373, 'last_played': 1535838383}
review:
[h1]Worth it on Sale[/h1]
A fun little game with a decent premise in which terrible acting and a nonsense plot actually work in its favour. It’s got a fair amount of jank, like regularly clipping through the roofs of buildings. (Once you've spawned inside solid geometry a few times in a row you'll know what I'm talking about.) Some levels can get quite frustrating and challenges can be a real pain in the ass, but overall it's a good time if you stick to the story levels. It’s fairly short, but if it was longer the b-movie camp would probably overstay its welcome, so it’s all for the best. Plus, when it’s on sale it’s under $3 Canadian. It’s totally worth at least that. If only the Deluxe Edition came w/ McElroy Bros commentary, too…

author: {'steamid': '76561198027267313', 'num_games_owned': 1838, 'num_reviews': 4460, 'playtime_forever': 578, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 578, 'last_played': 1533845379}
review:
Tags: Casual - Object Routes & Flinger
Additional Tags: Delete Local Content & Remove from Library

TLDR: Inept game design. Gimmick gone wrong. Avoid. Hotspot to Hotspot quest grind oriented driving game with clumsy on purpose controls. 

While the menus and minimap work decently the game still uses a driving style camera. The core gameplay is more akin to clumsy tube runner. The problem is that the camera does not really give you proper perspective on what you are trying to achieve. Furthermore, the design and layout of the map is usually fairly generic and does not seem to have been made custom designed to fit the mechanic.

The hitbox on your car is massive since it is a long thin limo, it rotates on itself constantly and you have no power over the steering. You can unlock an ability to rotate faster or jump but those are useless and clunky. Jumping even in paper lanterns will blow up the car so its uses are situational and usually pre scripted. Going faster just kills you faster. 

The gameplay loop ends up along the lines of staring at the minimap to get your bearings, dying on your way to the hotspot, usually respawning to the garage or some checkpoint that is closer to the quest, then picking up the passenger, having the mini scripted interaction play out, go from hotspot to hotspot dying regularly in between. Trigger a few banter lines. Reach a hotspot that is colored differently. Play the farewell exit video. Rise and repeat.

The game does unlock new areas and there seems to be a fairly varied cast of people. If the game used proper driving mechanics, and added more game mechanics to fleshen up the towns it could have been some strange FMV GTA1 parody of some sort. But as things stand what is on offer does not even compare to crazy taxi.

The acting was also fairly low energy and seemed like a cop out so they would not have to actually script any NPCS. The environments are static, bare, and mostly uninteractive. There are some random little townspeople but they just kind of scatter about randomly. The engine looked awfully unity-engine like as well despite the good cohesion with the UI.

There is a cosmetics shop but since you get paid pennies for doing missions you could never afford anything in it, and most of it looks fairly lackluster and uninteresting anyways.

As things stand this does not even have the mechanics necessary to compete with a proper Casual - Marble Routing game such as Rock of Ages. In fact I would recommend you play that instead, since at least you will have to engage with fun momentum management.
https://store.steampowered.com/app/434460/Rock_of_Ages_2_Bigger__Boulder/

review:
It's Driving, With A Twist!

Play Roundabout. It's such a fun time. Gameplay is nice, but the thing that keeps me playing are the FMV cutscenes that the game offers. They're just as corny as they should be, without coming off as annoying.

10/10, would murder triathalon runners for a possibly non-existant skeleton with my permanantly rotating limo again.

author: {'steamid': '76561198140146180', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 55, 'playtime_forever': 339, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 339, 'last_played': 1528420524}
review:
I'll keep it brief, and let others handle the details (except for some gameplay tips below) - I just want to give this game my 'two thumbs up'!
I laughed at surprisingly many of the FMV cutscenes ("the Giorgio stare", oh my), and a few in-game events, so besides the entertaining gameplay, this definitely earns the [b]fun[/b] stamp from me.

Various tips:
- It takes about 3 hours to finish the game, with no attention to completion %, but including trying all the challenges at least once. There is additional content/challenge available after that, but for starters assume that that is the playtime you'll get for your money.
- The first thing you see when you start the game, is that 'Playing with a controller is highly recommended'. I can confirm that is the case, as I played the game with a keyboard, and the non-analog "full speed-stop-full speed-stop" necessary to pass some obstructions isn't optimal. Don't let that discourage you from buying the game - just be prepared for a bit of frustration and restarts here and there, and that you won't get many of the "completed within x seconds" bonuses. It is [i]completely doable[/i] to play and finish with a keyboard.
- Once you leave the DMV, hit escape and take a look at the map. I didn't realize this was available until later in the game, and I had to make detours to visit some things I had missed while driving right by.
- Have a look in the graphical settings, and consider turning off "70's style visual effects". I found it distracting.
- If you just want to finish the game, don't bother collecting/earning money to buy houses. Some of the achievements require buying specific upgrades in the garage, so keep ~300$ for that.
- Once you finish the last story mission, once you start the game again, you are plopped back down into the last map, and you can drive around and explore and complete any objectives that you didn't previously.

author: {'steamid': '76561198007660744', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 229, 'playtime_forever': 310, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 310, 'last_played': 1526945197}

author: {'steamid': '76561197999899413', 'num_games_owned': 5069, 'num_reviews': 344, 'playtime_forever': 334, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 306, 'last_played': 1670374672}
review:
Take crazy taxi, give it a mesmerizing budget film filled to the brim with awesome FMV videos, and a genius gameplay mechanic and you have this game. This game comes off as easy to learn, fun to play, and hard to master. No Goblin has crafted a real gem with the comedy here. 

[h1]Pros[/h1]
+Great humor
+Intuitive gameplay mechanic
+Plenty of collectibles and secrets to be found
+Easy to learn and not unforgiving to mistakes

[h1]Cons[/h1]
-Kind of short story leaving you with wanting more. 

This games story is a little short but you can easily find yourself doing more with side missions and collectibles. You can easily squeeze out some great worthwhile gameplay out of this experience. You can tell with the FMV that this was probably just the funnest project to work on.

If you enjoy driving games, and want a twist, this is your title. If you enjoy cheesy FMV, this is your title. If you just want something unlike the normal games in your library; the mechanic in this game of the constant spinning tells me, this is your title. Give it a try.

[quote=Crimson-Albedo]Follow my reviews through my curator at [url=http://store.steampowered.com/curator/32482033/]Crim's Humble Opinion[/url][/quote]

author: {'steamid': '76561198025647144', 'num_games_owned': 402, 'num_reviews': 135, 'playtime_forever': 954, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 858, 'last_played': 1517753864}
review:
Roundabout est un jeu à part, difficile à recommander à n'importe qui.
Si vous aimez les trucs WTF, foncez, vous allez être servi.
Si vous êtes juste curieux et avez envie de tester quelque chose de différent, profitez de soldes ou d'un bundle, l'histoire principale se boucle en quelques heures et le jeu est relativement permissif, vous laissant repoper à l'infini à de nombreux checkpoints.
Mais si vous aimez le scoring ou êtes un complétionniste... préparez-vous à y perdre de nombreuses heures.

author: {'steamid': '76561198040712219', 'num_games_owned': 261, 'num_reviews': 43, 'playtime_forever': 2037, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1181, 'last_played': 1588631360}
review: One of the most underrated games on Steam. I'd love to see some more games having the guts to do what roundabout does: Innovative and compelling gameplay and a ridiculous spin on the story with b-movie elements (similar to deadly tower of monsters, but with FMV). Then again, seing that these games typically aren't huge commercial successes, I see why we don't have more of these games. Anyway, this game is whacky, also competitive. Replay value is there if you're like me and wanna nail the times, beat the e-sports run without dying, and so on. If you're not that kind of person, you're in for a whacky 2 - 4 hours, depending on how long it takes you to beat the game. In any case, one of my favorite games. If I could erase my memory of this game in ordner to play it again, I'd do it!

author: {'steamid': '76561198418549470', 'num_games_owned': 1157, 'num_reviews': 654, 'playtime_forever': 281, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 265, 'last_played': 1686099292}
review:
Lots of games here make me say w t f when I first start them up, but Roundabout has the high score for bizarro gameplay. Can you recommend this game? I am not sure, but you also can't not recommend this game. I am not sure you can appreciate it without playing it. I watched some videos of the gameplay, and I had no idea until I actualy started moving a rotating limosine down some uncomfortably tight passages. Is there any other game with controls so infuriating? At the same time, this game never hassles you for blowing up your limo and passenger ten times in a row. The video reward payoff makes it all worthwhile.

I bought this game for the Full Motion Video, after playing Press X Not to Die, and Roundabout delivered on that account. The game has a lot more interesting features, and it will keep me coming back to it to keep exploring. The designers put a lot into the game, and it is a unique experience. I think everyone should try it, just to see something very different. There is a lot of love and polish that went into Roundabout... cool music, funny joke upgrades, and little graphical effects... and this game would be otherwise easy to dismiss. Instead, this game that challenges you to enjoy a rich game world, while forcing you to explore it in the most a ridiculously inefficient way.

(update) Liking this even more, as I finish the first stage's challenges. I see this sometimes pokes fun at the Grand Theft Auto 2 gameplay, but it keeps getting more and more bizarro humor. It is like a joke that is funny, then it's not funny, then it is funny again. They did just such a great job with everything here. I really commend the technical designers and oddball minds that came up with these stories. And, it is working great on ubuntu linux 18.10 with radeon mesa graphic drivers. No problem dealing with gamepad controller disconnects. Two thumbs up!

author: {'steamid': '76561198091262422', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 1231, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1231, 'last_played': 1513482821}
review:
I cannot recommend this to any determined completionist. Bugs will be plentiful.
To everyone else, this is a pretty solid game.

A revolving limo is a neat idea. The comedy is spot-on. The open world is pretty good, but does get annoying when needing to travel to a place without the want of dealing with road hazards. Upgrades are pretty meh. Switching direction should have been bound to a button, not upgrade. Jumping was a very fitting idea, but it seemed as if it was thought of halfway through development, because it's not used very often. But the gameplay was generally fun and challenging (sometimes it wasn't a good kind of challenging).

For $15, I can't really recommend this. For $10, I think non-determined completionists would find value. But I do need to list the annoying bugs I've encountered, for anyone wanting to play:

Explosion sound not going away: happens when you die and restart just afterwards, sound can stack many, many, many times; fix: exit the game
Unable to jump: happens when you die or restart in an area where you aren't allowed to jump; fix: go into a no-jump area and come back out
Immediately hit as mission starts: just happens sometimes; fix: get onto a small ledge (like the island of a roundabout) such that the limo is angled and restart

If you can deal with a few annoying, unfixed bugs, then I recommend this. Determined completionists will probably find the bugs too annoying to deal with.

EDIT: After completing the game, I can say that completing the game is definitely very fun. But, unlocking all of the achievements wasn't so fun. The complete game experience was definitely recommendable, unless you want to get the high scores in some levels, then that part isn't fun when the bugs mentioned above start appearing. Otherwise, very good game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198095082555', 'num_games_owned': 543, 'num_reviews': 363, 'playtime_forever': 151, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 142, 'last_played': 1511909868}
review:
Very fun concept, challenging gameplay, and a loveable style. The cutscenes are very nice in a terrible way.

The performance is really strange though. Frame rate itself is perfectly fine, but at the same time the gameplay feels laggy and stuttery. Because the fps counter says 60 I assume it's poor frame pacing. It's quite distracting at it's worst and really takes down the experience. Price is way too steep for the length as well, but I got it for $2 so it's not much of a worry for me.

At it's core the game is good, but the technical flaws hurt it. Once again steam's rating system makes this difficult, but I'd say I would recommend it if you get it cheap.

author: {'steamid': '76561198047198058', 'num_games_owned': 354, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 103, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 103, 'last_played': 1482965980}
review:
Compellingly frustrating gameplay, a relentlessly catchy soundtrack, and hilariously cheesy fully acted cutscenes guiding you through a story of loss, love, strife, and a spinning limousine.
I was originally going to nominate this for the "suspension of disbelief" award in the Steam awards 2017, because after the first tutorial mission, you just take it for granted that yes, the car rotates. There's no attempt to explain how or why, but you just go with it as you attempt to negotiate the streets to complete missions, progressing the amusing storyline, or simply exploring to pick up special tokens, including bundles to cash, that allow you to mod your limo, or buy real estate around the city.
Ultimately, however, I nominated it for the "Whoooaaaaaa, Dude! 2.0" award, as that seemed far more appropriate overall.
For such a cheap and seemingly simple game, there's a surprising amount of depth, and even replayability - while you only need to mosey your way through any story quest once to progress, you can go back and repeat the missions as much as you like to attempt to improve your standing against your friends and globally.

All in all, I'd say that this game is fully worth the price even if it's not on special. When it's on an absurd sale, it's truly a no-brainer.

author: {'steamid': '76561198028479297', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 1063, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 922, 'last_played': 1607144287}
review:
This is a game in which you play a limo driver whose limo literally spins around.  In the daily course of your job, you meet a mechanic who promises to help you get into the big leagues, fight a French-Canadian ripoff, hallucinate a talking skeleton, and fall in love with a spotaneous young woman.

If that doesn't already sell you on this, I don't know what more I can tell you.  I guess I'll try, though.

Georgio Manos is a revolving limo driver who comes to the city of Roundabout in 1977 with the intention of acquiring fame, fortune, and hopefully very little nausea.  The game plays like a combination of Kuru Kuru Kururin and Crazy Taxi - your goal in each mission is to drive the passenger to their destination via a series of checkpoints while collecting coins, mowing down pedestrians, and avoiding obstacles.  It's simple to learn, challenging to master, and a whole lot of fun to watch.

As the game progresses, you unlock more powerups for your limo, such as the ability to slow down time, reverse which direction you're spinning, and fire traffic cones out of your trunk (no, really).  Between missions, you can explore the overworld to purchase properties around town, collect cash bundles, attempt special mini-game challenges, and unlock new horn noises for your limo.

The gameplay is plenty of fun on its own, but what really makes Roundabout stand out is the story.  Every cutscene is presented as something out of a cheesy 70s B-movie, mixing stock footage with actors so amateur that it's actually pretty adorable.  Georgio Manos never speaks a word, but it's not necessary - the facial expressions she gives the passengers is all the communication you need.  The eclectic cast of characters ranges from a nervous guy going out on a date, to an anarchist art enthusiast, to a hallucinated talking skeleton.  (Seriously, I can't emphasize the talking skeleton enough.)

My one major complaint is that trying to 100% the game can be incredibly frustrating.  Each mission has a series of bonus objectives which range from fairly doable (collect every coin) to nearly impossible (complete the mission in under 12 seconds), and picking up all the collectibles in the overworld is sure to drive you insane.
Additionally, the game is fairly short - you can probably complete the main story in just 6-7 hours.  But this is a more minor complaint, because the game fits everything it needs to into that time.  Any longer, and it would probably just feel like overkill.

All in all, Roundabout is a great game with a quirky sense of humor and a whole lot of creative heart.  If you're looking for an indie experience that unapologetically goes balls to the wall and never takes itself too seriously, this is for you.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970789804', 'num_games_owned': 2205, 'num_reviews': 94, 'playtime_forever': 218, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 218, 'last_played': 1442975772}
review:
[h1] What is Roundabout? [/h1]

Basically, the game is about a limo driver with lots to say and no time to say it. The gameplay itself is basically a large puzzle. In your rotating limo, you slide gently around the levels while collecting tokens and avoiding hitting things. Since the limo is automatically rotating, that's a challenge.

During the three to four hours of gameplay, you'll come across a colorful cast of characters, gain rivals and maybe even find love. The cheesy story is presented in film, which has a very fun low fi asthetic to it. The graphics of the game aren't anything special, but it's an arcadeish game, not some AAA blockbuster, so you'll likely forgive the technical aspects of the game.

[h1] How does the game perform? [/h1]

Admirably, but again the game isn't trying to win any technical awards so good performance is a requirement at this point. The music and sounds are about as good, with nothing to complain about nor speak of in particular. Of course, the cutscenes are great at the end of the day they'll be what you remember most of all.

[h1] Should I pick it up then? [/h1]

The game is basic, but then again it's also cheap. If you want a fun few hours, I'd recommend it. The game isn't going to stretch your skills or challenge your intellect but it's really *really* fun.

If you're not looking for a puzzle game, for a short game or for a game that's not very challenging, then I'd recommend avoiding Roundabout.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970901170', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 74, 'playtime_forever': 592, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 370, 'last_played': 1649211829}
review:
If there were more games like this in the world, we wouldn't have war, disease, and prejudice. We might be (financially) poorer though, because we'd have lots of games like this taking up all our productive time, conversation, and making us laugh. Trade-offs!

Roundabout is an arcade game about a rotating limo and humorous FMV cutscenes. The controls are great, FMV is skippable, saving is not a problem, and there are a variety of missions until the end of this not-exceedingly-long game. Solid buy.

author: {'steamid': '76561198053566405', 'num_games_owned': 400, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 1099, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1099, 'last_played': 1502571940}
review: Such a unique, excellent game! Fun action puzzle mechanics, lots of collectibles, entertaining FMV cutscenes, varied challenges and missions. Bonus points for nailing the cheesy, retro vibe. Definitely worth your time.

author: {'steamid': '76561198003142691', 'num_games_owned': 339, 'num_reviews': 112, 'playtime_forever': 21, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 21, 'last_played': 1500604050}
review: Basically this is a driving puzzle game. The gameplay videos convey the entirity of what you'll be facing here. You have to carefully navigate a spinning car through tight pathways. It's challenging and despite how chaotic it looks precision is rewarded and carelessness punished. If that type of gameplay is something you're into - the weirdly charming FMV sequences will just be a bonus. I obviously am not in the mood for this sort fo game often (hence low play time) but for what it is - it's one of the best.

author: {'steamid': '76561197960434414', 'num_games_owned': 2919, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 131, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 131, 'last_played': 1478999053}
review:
This game is great on so many levels.  The gameplay is unique and challenging, and reminds me of a Game Boy Advance series called Kuru Kuru Kururin.  Essentially you navigate a spinning stick, in this case a taxi, throughout a city to get passengers to their destinations.  

The FMV story and voice acting tell the game's story, and really make Roundabout a real experience though.

review: So I bought this on impulse thinking not much of it but when i started playing the game I found myself hooked.  A spinning limo trying to naviage through a city is seems dumb but it's really was addiciting.  the actors were good and i ended up really likeing the gameplay/cutscenes.  It really did have that B movie feel .

author: {'steamid': '76561198213532837', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 67, 'playtime_forever': 464, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 405, 'last_played': 1502610079}

review: A fun and funny navigation puzzle game, definitely worth checking out. However, compared to Kuru Kuru Kururin, the game which Roundabout is copying, the mechanics aren't quite as solid nor is the main concept as exhaustively explored in the level design.

author: {'steamid': '76561198000531072', 'num_games_owned': 632, 'num_reviews': 43, 'playtime_forever': 153, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 153, 'last_played': 1498323577}
review: Very unique concept too here with a simple driving game with FMV+stock video mixed with the odd driving mechanic of constantly rotating. Not a hard game or a long game though excellent on the design/gameplay/writing/theme. Both this and the game Headlander are great at capturing that 1970s theme with some wonderful writing. Ton of fun extras too & even more fun things in the deluxe edition. Highly recommended & well worth the time.

author: {'steamid': '76561198010315744', 'num_games_owned': 1309, 'num_reviews': 725, 'playtime_forever': 188, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 188, 'last_played': 1498348491}
review:
I bought this game mostly because there is a special place in my heart for FMV in video games...yeah its cheesy but that's what makes it so enjoyable. 

I was also excited to discover the actual game is pretty fun! Coins to collect, people to run over, multipliers going up (and down) to blowing up my own car numerous times I never got frustrated. I figured it would get tougher and tougher as the levels went on but it really didn't and that was good because I got to focus on enjoying the story. 

After finishing th game today I also purchased the deluxe content (80%off sale) mostly again- just for the videos and "making of". It was ok and for a buck I treat it as a little extra for the devs. They really worked hard on this thing and it shows. Although on the downside I was slightly disappointed there weren't any outtakes but no big deal.
